intro: Minuartia moraldoi, commonly known as the Moravská rockcress, is a small, mat-forming flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is native to rocky and alpine environments in Central Europe, particularly in regions of the Czech Republic and Slovakia. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers with four petals, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are linear and arranged in a rosette pattern, adapted to withstand harsh mountain conditions. Minuartia moraldoi is often found growing on limestone or other calcareous substrates, thriving in well-drained, sunny habitats.
